intro: Vellozia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented vellozia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Podostomataceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found near streams or in wetlands. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
